snippet: The targets were often linked to the standoff in Ukraine, said iSight Partners, the computer security firm that released the report.
abstract: Computer security firm iSight Partners reports that Russian hackers used a bug in Microsoft Windows to spy on several Western governments, NATO and the Ukrainian government.
lead_paragraph: The targets were often linked to the standoff in Ukraine, said iSight Partners, the computer security firm that released the report.

headline.main: Russian Hackers Used Bug in Microsoft Windows for Spying, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Report Details a Bug Exploited by Hackers
